arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Saints beat QPR, Small stunner fires Preston
arts.sum: Scienza goal gives managerless Southampton 2-1 win Preston defeat Swansea; Wednesday and Norwich draw Managerless Southampton ended their losing run with a 2-1 victory at QPR in their first match since the sacking of Will Still. Teenager Jay Robinson’s deflected strike put the visitors, who had under-21s coach Tonda Eckert in interim charge, ahead early in the second half and Léo Scienza’s brilliant goal doubled their lead. Rumarn Burrell pulled a goal back but Rangers were unable to find an equaliser, slumping to a third consecutive defeat. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Southampton beat QPR in first game after Still departure
arts.sum: Managerless Southampton ended their losing run with a 2-1 victory at QPR in their first match since the sacking of Will Still.

arts.ttl: “I’m going to go…”: Former EFL player drops QPR vs Southampton score prediction
arts.sum: QPR have lost their last two Championship games on the spin and are back in action on Wednesday night. The post “I’m going to go…”: Former EFL player drops QPR vs Southampton score prediction appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.sum: Kwame Poku only made his QPR return last Saturday, but the summer signing has suffered a new injury setback. The post 24-year-old to miss QPR’s clash with Southampton amid new injury appeared first on The72 - Football League News.

arts.ttl: QPR vs Southampton predictions: Managerless Saints can make their point
arts.sum: Southampton parted ways with their manager this week but Ian Wilkerson feels they can make a positive start to life without him, given QPR's stuttering form.
